title: Housing Application Process and Requirements
content:
The housing application process at University begins each spring for the upcoming academic year. All incoming first-year students are required to live on campus for their first two years unless they meet specific exemption criteria such as living with immediate family within a 30-mile radius.

To apply for housing, students must first accept their offer of admission and pay the enrollment deposit. Once completed, they will receive access to the Housing Portal within 3-5 business days. The application requires students to complete a lifestyle questionnaire, select their preferred housing type (traditional double, suite-style, or apartment), and rank their top three residence hall choices.

The housing application fee is $300, which serves as the security deposit and is refundable upon proper checkout at the end of the housing contract. Students with documented medical needs or disabilities should contact the Office of Accessibility Services to request specific accommodations before submitting their housing application.

Application deadlines are strictly enforced: March 1st for priority consideration and May 1st for the general deadline. Late applications are accepted on a space-available basis. Students who submit by the priority deadline receive earlier room selection times and have better chances of receiving their preferred assignments.

After submitting the application, students will receive a confirmation email with their housing lottery number. This number, combined with the application date, determines the room selection time slot.
snippet: Learn about housing application requirements, deadlines, and the step-by-step process for securing on-campus housing at University.

title: Room Selection Dates and Priority System
content:
Room selection for the upcoming academic year follows a structured timeline that prioritizes students based on class standing and application submission date. Understanding this system helps students secure their preferred housing assignments.

The room selection period typically runs from April 15th through April 30th. Selection time slots are assigned as follows: Seniors and juniors select during the first week, sophomores during the second week, and incoming first-year students during the third week. Within each class year, students who submitted applications by the priority deadline receive earlier time slots.

Students will receive an email notification 48 hours before their assigned selection time with login instructions for the Housing Portal. During your selection window, you can view real-time availability of rooms, see floor plans, and lock in your preferred space. Selections are final once confirmed, though room change requests can be submitted after move-in.

Roommate groups must coordinate their selection times. The group member with the earliest time slot can pull in their roommate(s) during selection, even if the roommate has a later slot. Groups must be linked in the Housing Portal at least 72 hours before the first group member's selection time.

Students who miss their selection window are automatically placed in available spaces based on their preferences. To avoid this, ensure your contact information is current in the Housing Portal and set reminders for your selection date.
snippet: Room selection runs April 15-30. Priority is based on class standing and application date. Link roommate groups 72 hours before selection.

title: Using the Roommate Finder Tool
content:
The Roommate Finder Tool is an online matching system designed to help students find compatible roommates based on lifestyle preferences and habits. This tool is available to all students who have submitted their housing application and completed the lifestyle questionnaire.

To access the Roommate Finder, log into the Housing Portal and navigate to the Roommates tab. The system uses your questionnaire responses to generate a compatibility percentage with other students seeking roommates. You can filter potential matches by gender, sleep schedule, cleanliness preferences, noise tolerance, and study habits.

The matching algorithm considers factors such as wake-up and bedtime preferences, attitudes toward guests and visitors, temperature preferences, and whether you prefer a quiet or social environment. Students are encouraged to answer the questionnaire honestly rather than ideally to ensure accurate matches.

Once you find a potential match, you can send a roommate request through the system. Both students must confirm the pairing before the deadline to be assigned together. You can message potential roommates directly through the portal to get to know each other before committing.

Roommate groups can include 2-4 students depending on the room type selected. All group members must have compatible housing preferences (same residence hall type and room configuration). Groups are automatically dissolved if preferences conflict, so communicate with potential roommates before forming a group.

The Roommate Finder closes one week before room selection begins. Students without confirmed roommate groups will be matched by the housing office based on questionnaire responses.
snippet: Find compatible roommates using our online matching tool. Filter by lifestyle preferences, message potential matches, and form groups of 2-4.

title: Move-In Day Schedule and Check-In Procedures
content:
Move-in day is an exciting time that requires careful planning. The University assigns specific move-in dates and time slots to ensure a smooth experience for all students and families. Your assigned time will be emailed approximately two weeks before move-in day.

Move-in for fall semester typically occurs over a four-day period in late August. First-year students move in on Thursday and Friday, while returning students arrive Saturday and Sunday. Each student receives a two-hour check-in window. Arriving outside your assigned window may result in extended wait times.

On your move-in day, follow campus signage to your designated parking area. Volunteers will assist with unloading and provide carts for transporting belongings. After unloading (approximately 15-20 minutes), move your vehicle to the designated long-term parking areas to allow space for other families.

Check-in takes place in your residence hall lobby. Bring your student ID and a government-issued photo ID. You will receive your room key, access card, and welcome packet containing important information about building policies, emergency procedures, and campus resources.

Before entering your room, complete the Room Condition Report (RCR) documenting any existing damage or issues. This protects you from charges at move-out. Submit the RCR within 48 hours of move-in through the Housing Portal.

Orientation activities begin the evening of move-in day. Check your email for the welcome week schedule, which includes floor meetings, campus tours, and social events designed to help you connect with your community.
snippet: Move-in occurs late August with assigned time slots. Bring two forms of ID, complete the Room Condition Report within 48 hours of arrival.

title: What to Bring (and Not Bring) to Your Dorm
content:
Packing for college requires balancing comfort with limited space. This guide helps you prepare for dorm living with essential items while avoiding prohibited or unnecessary belongings.

Essential items to bring include: bedding for extra-long twin mattresses (36" x 80"), towels and toiletries, shower caddy and flip-flops for communal bathrooms, desk lamp, power strip with surge protector (UL-listed), hangers and closet organizers, laundry basket and supplies, fan (air conditioning availability varies by building), and basic first aid supplies.

For academics, bring your laptop and chargers, school supplies, desk organizers, and a small printer if desired (campus printing is also available). A mini-fridge (4.5 cubic feet max) and microwave (700 watts max) are permitted; many students opt for the combo rental program offered through the University.

Prohibited items include: candles, incense, or open-flame devices; hot plates, toasters, or appliances with exposed heating elements; space heaters; halogen lamps; extension cords (use power strips instead); pets (except approved service animals and emotional support animals with documentation); weapons of any kind; alcohol in first-year residence halls.

Items provided by the University include: bed frame with mattress, desk and chair, dresser, closet or wardrobe, window blinds, and ethernet connection. Do not bring large furniture pieces as rooms are already furnished.

Coordinate with your roommate before move-in to avoid duplicates of shared items like mini-fridges, microwaves, rugs, and TVs. The Housing Portal includes a shared packing list feature to help roommates coordinate.
snippet: Bring extra-long twin bedding, surge protectors, and shower supplies. Leave candles, hot plates, and extension cords at home. Coordinate with roommates.

title: How to Submit a Maintenance Request
content:
The Housing Maintenance team is committed to keeping residence halls safe and comfortable. Students can submit maintenance requests 24/7 through the Housing Portal, and our team prioritizes issues based on urgency and safety.

To submit a request, log into the Housing Portal and select Maintenance Request from the menu. Provide a detailed description of the issue, including its exact location within your room or common area. You can upload photos to help technicians understand the problem before arriving. Select the appropriate category: electrical, plumbing, heating/cooling, pest control, furniture, locks/keys, or general repairs.

Maintenance requests are categorized by priority: Emergency issues (no heat, flooding, electrical hazards, security concerns) are addressed within 2-4 hours. Urgent issues (hot water problems, broken locks, significant leaks) are handled within 24 hours. Routine requests (minor repairs, furniture issues, cosmetic concerns) are typically completed within 3-5 business days.

For true emergencies outside business hours, contact Campus Safety at (555) 123-4567. They will dispatch emergency maintenance personnel or take immediate safety measures as needed.

Maintenance staff will enter your room to complete repairs, typically providing 24-hour notice except for emergencies. You do not need to be present, but valuable items should be secured. After completion, you will receive an email confirmation and can provide feedback on the service.

Recurring issues should be reported each time they occur, as this helps identify systemic problems that may require more extensive repairs.
snippet: Submit maintenance requests via the Housing Portal. Emergencies handled in 2-4 hours, routine repairs in 3-5 business days. Include photos when possible.

title: Room Change Request Process
content:
While we encourage students to work through differences with roommates, we understand that sometimes a room change is necessary for a positive living experience. The room change process opens two weeks after the start of each semester to allow time for initial adjustment.

Before requesting a room change, students should attempt to resolve conflicts through direct communication with their roommate. If issues persist, contact your Resident Advisor (RA) for mediation support. RAs are trained in conflict resolution and can help establish roommate agreements addressing common concerns like noise, guests, cleanliness, and shared space usage.

If mediation is unsuccessful or the situation involves safety concerns, you may submit a Room Change Request through the Housing Portal. The request requires a written explanation of the situation and whether mediation was attempted. The Housing office reviews requests weekly and responds within 5-7 business days.

Room changes are granted based on availability and the nature of the request. Priority is given to situations involving safety concerns, documented harassment, or significant lifestyle incompatibilities that cannot be resolved through mediation. Requests based on minor preferences or convenience are accommodated only if space permits.

If approved, you will receive instructions for your move date and new assignment. Both moves in and out must be completed within the specified timeframe (typically 48-72 hours). Your RA will conduct checkout of your current room and check-in at your new location.

Note that emergency room changes due to safety concerns bypass the standard process. Contact your RA or Hall Director immediately if you feel unsafe.
snippet: Room changes open two weeks after semester start. Try mediation with your RA first. Submit requests via Housing Portal; responses within 5-7 days.

title: Meal Plan Options and Dining Locations
content:
The University offers several meal plan options to accommodate different eating habits, schedules, and budgets. All students living in traditional residence halls are required to have a meal plan; apartment-style residents may opt out.

The Unlimited Plan provides unlimited swipes at dining halls plus $200 in Flex Dollars per semester for use at campus cafes and convenience stores. This plan is ideal for students who eat most meals on campus and prefer the flexibility of eating whenever they want.

The 14-Meal Plan includes 14 dining hall swipes per week (Monday-Sunday) plus $400 in Flex Dollars. This option works well for students who typically eat two meals per day on campus or frequently eat off-campus on weekends.

The 10-Meal Plan offers 10 swipes per week plus $600 in Flex Dollars. This plan suits students with irregular schedules or those who prefer more grab-and-go options from campus cafes.

The Block 175 Plan provides 175 swipes per semester (approximately 11 per week) plus $300 in Flex Dollars. This option offers maximum flexibility for students whose eating patterns vary week to week.

Flex Dollars carry over between fall and spring semesters but expire at the end of the academic year. Unused dining swipes do not carry over to the following week. Guest swipes can be purchased separately or added to any plan.

Dining halls accommodate various dietary needs including vegetarian, vegan, halal, kosher, and allergen-free options. Students with specific dietary requirements should contact Dining Services to discuss accommodations. Meal plan changes can be made during the first two weeks of each semester through the Housing Portal.
snippet: Choose from Unlimited, 14-Meal, 10-Meal, or Block 175 plans. All include Flex Dollars for campus cafes. Changes allowed in first two weeks.

title: Guest and Visitor Policy
content:
Residence halls welcome guests while maintaining a safe and comfortable environment for all residents. Understanding the guest policy helps students host visitors responsibly and respectfully.

Day guests (visits between 8 AM and midnight) do not require registration. The host student must meet their guest at the building entrance and escort them at all times. Guests must carry a valid photo ID. Day guests may visit common areas and the host's room but should respect quiet hours and community guidelines.

Overnight guests must be registered through the Housing Portal at least 24 hours in advance. Each resident may host overnight guests for a maximum of three consecutive nights and no more than six nights per month. Overnight guests are not permitted during finals week or the first week of classes.

Roommate consent is required for all overnight guests. If roommates cannot reach agreement, the resident without a guest takes priority. Repeated conflicts should be addressed through your RA.

Guests under 18 years old must have written parental permission on file and can only visit during designated family weekend periods. All guests must comply with residence hall policies; the host student is responsible for their guest's behavior.

Cohabitation (a guest staying regularly or keeping belongings in the room) is prohibited. Violations may result in loss of guest privileges or other conduct sanctions. Building access is restricted after midnight; guests staying past this time must remain in the building until 8 AM unless escorted out by their host.

For events involving multiple guests, such as study groups or birthday celebrations, notify your RA in advance to ensure compliance with room occupancy limits.
snippet: Day guests need escort; overnight guests require 24-hour advance registration and roommate consent. Maximum 3 consecutive nights, 6 nights monthly.

title: Move-Out Procedures and Checkout Process
content:
A smooth move-out process protects your security deposit and ensures a good transition for incoming residents. Whether moving out at the end of the year or mid-semester, follow these procedures to complete checkout properly.

Move-out dates are published in the academic calendar. Spring semester move-out typically occurs within 24 hours of your last final exam. Students participating in commencement may stay until noon the day after graduation. Extended stay requests must be submitted through the Housing Portal at least two weeks in advance.

Before leaving, thoroughly clean your room: remove all personal belongings, empty and defrost the refrigerator (if applicable), sweep or vacuum floors, wipe down surfaces, and take out all trash. Return the room to the condition documented in your Room Condition Report from move-in.

Schedule a checkout appointment with your RA through the Housing Portal. During this 15-minute appointment, your RA will inspect the room, document any damage beyond normal wear and tear, and collect your room key and access card. If you cannot schedule an appointment, you may complete an Express Checkout by returning keys to the front desk and leaving your door open for inspection.

Charges for damage, excessive cleaning, or unreturned keys will be deducted from your security deposit. Common charges include: unreturned key ($75), lock change if key is lost ($150), furniture damage ($50-500 depending on severity), and excessive cleaning ($100-250). You will receive an itemized statement within 30 days.

Summer storage is available for a fee through University Storage Services. Items left behind after move-out will be donated or disposed of after 48 hours.
snippet: Clean thoroughly, schedule RA checkout, return all keys. Move-out within 24 hours of last final. Charges deducted from deposit for damages.
